snippet: A suspect behind a 2009 attack on a Belgian ship was lured to Brussels with an offer to make a film about his piracy past, the authorities said.
abstract: Belgian authorities say Mohamed Abdi Hassan, man suspected of being a pirate mastermind, was arrested at Brussels airport and charged with kidnapping, organized crime and piracy; say Hassan and his accomplice Mohamed Aden were lured to Belgium by proposal for a film project.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and NICHOLAS KULISH

lead_paragraph: A suspect behind a 2009 attack on a Belgian ship was lured to Brussels with an offer to make a film about his piracy past, the authorities said.

headline.main: A Proposed Movie Deal for a Piracy Suspect Has a Surprise Ending: His Arrest
headline.print_headline: A Proposed Movie Deal for a Piracy Suspect Has a Surprise Ending: His Arrest
